Uses of Class
battle.StatusBuilder

    • Uses of StatusBuilder in battle

      Methods in battle that return StatusBuilder 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.addListener(StatusHandler listener)
      Adds a new StatusHandler object to receive method calls during appropriate events in the skill, such status application and removal.
      static StatusBuilder Status.builder(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a new StatusBuilder object using the name property of the given String.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setApplyCondition(java.util.function.Predicate<Fighter> applyCondition)
      Sets the test condition that returns true if the status can be successfully applied to the target owner of the status to be built.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setAsInfinite()
      Sets this so that the status to be built can not expire due to the passing of time.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setAsInstant()
      Sets the status to be built so that it would be marked for removal immediately after being applied.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setDefeating(boolean defeats)
      Sets the status to be built so that it can defeat the fighter it is applied to when set to true.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setDescription(java.lang.String description)
      Sets the description of how the status to be built is intended to interact with Fighter objects it is applied to, as well as its interactions with other Status objects on the same fighter.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setDuration(java.time.Duration duration)
      Sets the time before this status expires once it is applied.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setHidden(boolean hidden)
      Sets the status to be built so that it should not be visible to the user of the client when set to true.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setName(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name that identifies the status to be built from unrelated Status objects.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setRemoveCondition(java.util.function.Predicate<Fighter> removeCondition)
      Sets the test condition that returns true if the status can be successfully removed from the owner of the status to be built.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setStackable(boolean stackable)
      Sets the status to be built so that it can have a stack size greater then 1 when set to true.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setStackSize(int stackSize)
      Sets the current number of stacks.
      StatusBuilder StatusBuilder.setStunning(boolean stunning)
      Sets the status to be built so that it can stun the fighter it is applied to when set to true.
